oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Mary Burnett to Jacob Burnett on "Liberty and Union, Now and Forever" stationery
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Mary Burnett to her husband Jacob Burnett discussing a ring she made, an incident in Warsaw, Kentucky, where two Federal men were nearly hanged, and the death of William Kittle. Offers to send him newspapers and clothing and asks if he will be home for the winter. Stationery features a female figure resembling Lady Liberty with an American flag.
Jacob J. Burnett was a Federal infantryman who served in the 7th Regiment of the Indiana Infantry. He enlisted September 13, 1861, and was discharged with a disability on March 24, 1863.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Burnett, Mary
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Letters
